## Debuffer() function

Debuffer function calls by a specified amount of time The function will only be executed every `ms` milliseconds Every call within this timeframe are blocked and the timeframe reset. Useful for possible multiple event triggersn.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function Debuffer(ms?: number): (target: any, key: string, desc: TypedPropertyDescriptor<TFunction<any, any[], any>>) => TypedPropertyDescriptor<TFunction<any, any[], any>>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  ms | <code>number</code> | The amount of milliseconds to debuffer it by |

<b>Returns:</b>

`(target: any, key: string, desc: TypedPropertyDescriptor<TFunction<any, any[], any>>) => TypedPropertyDescriptor<TFunction<any, any[], any>>`

## Remarks

If you want calls to execute the function after the specified time block subsequent calls, use [Debounce()](./vue-extra-decorators.debounce.md) instead.

## Example


```TS
  @Debuffer(1000)
  onSearchLiveChange(ev: Event) {
    // Only ever executed every 1000 ms, immediately after first invocation
  }

```
Call limiting decorators: [Debounce()](./vue-extra-decorators.debounce.md) [Debuffer()](./vue-extra-decorators.debuffer.md) [LimitToFrames()](./vue-extra-decorators.limittoframes.md)

Interval decorators: [Every()](./vue-extra-decorators.every.md) [EveryFrame()](./vue-extra-decorators.everyframe.md)
